Bill Clinton chooses Gore to be his running mate in the 1992 presidential election.
Inaugurated as vice president.
Second term as vice president begins.
Gore states in an interview on CNN with Wolf Blitzer, "During my service in the United States Congress, I took the initiative in creating the Internet.

I took the initiative in moving forward a whole range of initiatives that have proven to be important to our country's economic growth and environmental protection, improvements in our educational system."
This quote creates a large amount of rhetoric with his opponents.
Announces his intention to run for president in the 2000 election.
Wins the Democratic Party nomination.
Election Day.
Concedes in the early morning to George W. Bush but later retracts his concession.
Florida is too close to call for either Bush or Gore.
Requests a recount in Florida.
Concedes the election to Bush after the US Supreme Court rules that another recount in Florida would be unconstitutional, 36 days after the election.
Joins the board of directors for Apple Computers Inc.
Announces intention to purchase Newsworld International from Vivendi Universal SA for an undisclosed price and plans to transform it into a network aimed at viewers ages 18-35.
Gore's cable television channel, Current TV, debuts.
Joins Sir Richard Branson at a press conference announcing the $25 million Virgin Earth Challenge, a prize for a design to safely remove man-made greenhouse gases from the atmosphere.
Gore and Branson are among the judges.
Announces a series of concerts called Live Earth to be held on all seven continents on July 7, 2007.
The 24-hour music event is the kickoff of a campaign to "Save Our Selves (SOS)."
"An Inconvenient Truth" wins an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.
Testifies at separate House and Senate events, urging legislation to curb climate change.
Is co-winner of the Nobel Peace Prize for work on global warming.
Receives the Prince of Asturias Award for International Cooperation.
Announces he is joining the venture capital firm of Kleiner, Perkins, Caufield and Byers.
He will help the company invest in start-up "green" companies.
Gore will also donate his salary to the Alliance for Climate Protection.
Accepts the Nobel Peace Prize
Receives NAACP Chairman's Award during the annual Image Award ceremony.
The honor is given in recognition of special achievement and distinguished public service.
This year's award is shared with Dr. Wangari Muta Maathai.
Gore and wife Tipper, announce they are to separate after 40 years of marriage.
Qatar-based broadcaster Al Jazeera purchases Current TV for a reported $500 million, personally netting Gore an estimated $70 million.
Meets with President-elect Donald Trump to speak about climate change issues.
